original_title: Playdium launches Sri Lanka’s first-ever Playdium Pin League
original_body_lines: Playdium, Sri Lanka’s premier bowling and entertainment arena, successfully hosted the inaugural Playdium Pin League (PPL) recently, marking a significant advancement in the nation’s sporting and leisure landscape.

The debut tournament brought together 22 teams comprising more than 100 corporate and open players, all competing on Brunswick Champion standard bowling alleys, the same technology utilized in leading international tournaments. The event generated a dynamic atmosphere, drawing attention to bowling’s growing popularity in Sri Lanka.
At the conclusion of an evening of spirited competition, the Champion Award winners were Panther Paces, with Fireball and Ball Burners emerging as 1st and 2nd runner-up.

“Hosting the first-ever Premier Bowling League in Sri Lanka is a proud milestone for us,” stated Ashan de Livera, Director of Playdium. “Our vision has always been to provide a platform where competition and entertainment converge, allowing both corporates and individuals to experience bowling at international standards. The success of the inaugural PPL confirms the sport’s growing foothold in Sri Lanka and we are committed to establishing this as a bi-annual competition.”

Strategically located on the ground floor of Shangri-La’s One Galle Face Mall, Playdium is designed to meet international benchmarks as Sri Lanka’s largest world-class bowling and entertainment facility. Beyond its Brunswick Champion standard lanes and advanced scoring systems, the venue spans over 20,000 square feet and features an extensive range of attractions, including Arcade Games, Kids’ Play Area, VR Zone, Bumper Car Zone, Karaoke and Party Facilities as well as the Champions Table Restaurant

By combining state-of-the-art facilities with diverse leisure offerings, Playdium is redefining Colombo’s urban entertainment sector, positioning itself as a premier destination for corporate team-building, competitive sports leagues, social gatherings, family recreation and tourism.
